title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 351.6 - Proper deductions for presbycusis and other nonindustrial causes of hearing impairment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 351.6 - Proper deductions for presbycusis and other nonindustrial causes of hearing impairment

State Regulations

With respect to presbycusis, no allowance should be made
for the possible effect of age on the hearing level. With respect to the
possible effect of nonindustrial causes of an individual's hearing impairment
other than presbycusis, determination of the amount of loss due to such other
causes should be made by the examining otologist. The opinion of the examining
otologist as to the etiological factors responsible for the patient's hearing
loss, and the extent to which each contributed to such loss, together with all
other pertinent data, should be taken into consideration in fixing the amount
of the award to be paid. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
351.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
